issue.title: [C++] Add SSE4.2-accelerated hash kernels and use if host CPU supports
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1822](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1822). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
SSE4.2 has CRC32 intrinsics that can be used to compute hash values. It seems it may be acceptable to use `-msse4.2` on isolated compilation units, but if this object code is used on a machine without support for the SIMD instructions, then it will crash
